title: Herdade Grande 2015 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)
description: Forgoing wood aging, this wine is attractively fruity and crisp. Ripe apple and pear flavors fill out its frame of lemon fruit and bright acidity. Pineapple and white peach notes complete the picture. Drink now.

title: Katherine Goldschmidt 2014 Crazy Creek Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Plush yet structured tannins and juicy, easygoing cassis and cranberry flavors allow this wine to sing. Deeper black fruit touches complement the brightness, adding power and concentration.

title: Klein Constantia 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Constantia)
description: This opens with pure aromas of green plum, gooseberry and fresh herbs—the herbal notes so prominent, it's almost reminiscent of a men's fragrance. The lightweight palate is bright in acidity and crisp, tart lime-focused flavor. Drink now.

title: Kössler 2015 Pinot Nero (Alto Adige)
description: This 100% Pinot Nero opens with aromas of red currant and baking spice. The lively palate delivers red cherry, black tea and a hint of ginger alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Zolo 2016 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Attractive berry aromas are candied and a tiny bit leafy. Tartaric acidity is front and center on the palate, but there's enough tasty yet generic berry flavors along with notes of clove and chocolate to handle forced acidity.
designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled

title: Trizanne 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Elim)
description: Fresh herbal tones of thyme and fynbos welcome you into the nose of this wine alongside fruity notes of lemon and white peach. The vibrant palate offers zippy, mouthwatering acidity, while a slightly bitter, pithy astringency lingers softly on the finish. Drink now–2018.

title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Harvest Select Sweet Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of honeysuckle and ripe peach lead to lightly spritzy medium-sweet stone-fruit flavors. It provides easy-drinking appeal.

title: Chronic Cellars 2015 Dead Nuts Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This Zinfandel-based wine, which blends 13% Tempranillo and 6% Petite Sirah, shows strawberry, cherry, baking spice and cola aromas. There is decent tannic tension on the palate, and the flavors—sarsaparilla, cola, stewed plum and clove spice—are easily enjoyable.

title: Chronic Cellars 2015 Suite Petite Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling from the Beckett brothers—bolstered with 14% Syrah—is yet another crowd-pleaser from their stylish, affordable label. Plump black-fruit aromas meet iodine and dried purple-flower notes on the nose. The palate is rich and soft at first, growing tannic over time, with dark purple-fruit flavors that last long into the finish, edged in bright acidity.

title: Clos de L'Oratoire des Papes 2015 White (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Modest pear, pineapple and lemon oil scents mark the nose, while the palate suggests marshmallow, pear and melon. This is full bodied and slightly honeyed in style, with a long, plush finish redolent of ripe citrus. Drink now.

title: Colinas do Douro 2015 Superior White (Douro)
description: Grown at 1,800 feet, the vines for this wine benefit from the cool conditions needed to develop aromatic intensity. With crisp acidity combined with spiced pear and nutmeg flavors, it's both tightly textured and very fruity. Drink now.

title: Conn Creek 2013 Rutherford Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Mild with raspberry flavor and soft, integrated oak and tannin, this full-bodied wine is comprised entirely of Cabernet Sauvignon and imparts a characteristic Rutherford dustiness on the palate.

title: Del Carlo Winery 2012 Teldeschi Vineyards Home Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is an approachable, affordable wine that impresses on every level. It combines raspberry, vanilla and plum flavors with juicy, moderate acidity and rounded texture, the fruit accented with clove, cedar and bay leaf notes.

title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2015  Chablis
description: From vineyards on the cooler south bank of the Serein, this wine is crisp and tightly coiled despite the warmth of the 2015 vintage. It's built on a backbone of sturdy minerality, fleshed out with crisp, citrus fruit, and will be ready to drink from late 2017.
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

title: Van Loveren 2016 Christina The Heritage Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)
description: Fresh and vibrant, this offers lively notes of green gooseberry as well as lime pith and leaf that continue on to the light, zippy palate. It's clean, bright and easy to drink, with a saline accent on the close. Drink now.

title: Château Armandière 2014 Ancestral Malbec (Cahors)
description: From the Bouyssou family estate, this structured wine is perfumed, ripe with black fruits and firmly based on serious tannins. It has weight and richness with spice and concentration. At the end, the acidity is crisp and juicy. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Beauséjour 2013 Red (Bergerac Sec)
description: Organically grown fruit, aged in new wood for 12 months, creates this rich smooth wine. With a juicy oxidative character, it is soft and round. Yellow fruits and spice come together in a wine that is now ready to drink.

title: Château La Nerthe 2013 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: This is not nearly as rich and plush as La Nerthe's luxury-level Cuvée des Cadettes, but remains a very good wine. Red plum and red currant fruit is medium-bodied, supported by bright acids, while some slightly ashy notes and a hint of cocoa emerge on the crisp finish.

title: Château Lamartine 2014 Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: This is Alain Gayraud's estate wine. With 90% Malbec and 10% Merlot, it certainly shows some of the tannins typical of the grape. At the same time, it has attractive berry fruits and balanced acidity. It has a light touch that will make it ready to drink soon. Drink from 2018.

title: Alder Fels 2015 The Eagle Rock Chardonnay (California)
description: Bright green apple and herb flavors and light to medium body make this non-oaky wine refreshing and lean in profile. It has appetizing acidity, a great sense of freshness and a lingering finish.

title: André Brunel 2015 Domaine de la Becassonne White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: This is an easy-drinking, harmonious blend of 50% Roussanne, 30% Grenache Blanc and 20% Clairette. Pineapplle, anise and marshmallow aromas lead into well-rounded flavors of pineapple and melon. Drink now.

title: Apothic 2015 White (California)
description: Lightly sweet and rich in both flavor and body, this wine has generous ripe pear and peach notes accented with coconut and vanilla. A layered effect to the flavors and an especially creamy texture make it very tempting.

title: Bedell 2015 Taste White (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Pronounced notes of struck flint and burnt matches take quite a while to dissipate, but reveal prettier tones of lemon, grapefruit and lime aromas with aeration. It's a smoky savory wine with delicate fruit concentration but it's also zesty and refreshing.

title: Bellingham 2015 Citrus Grove Chenin Blanc (Coastal Region)
description: Bright and light on its feet, this is a pleasant and sunny wine that's loaded with crisp citrus and green apple aromas and flavors. There's a subtle, surprising smoothness to the palate, though zippy acidity picks up on the midpalate and through the clean finish. Drink now.

title: Boas Quintas 2015 Quinta da Fonte do OuroTinto Encruzado (Dão)
description: This wood-aged wine has spicy aromas. On the palate, it's creamy and toasty, its ripe fruit and tangy texture giving it richness. Acidity keeps it crisp and fruity. Drink from late 2017.

title: Borne 2014 Mile Marker 33.89 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: Medium bodied and fresh-tasting, this well-balanced wine emphasizes its apple and lemon flavors without much oak intervention. It has refreshing acidity and a clean finish.

title: Kunde 2015 Magnolia Lane Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine is lightly layered and linear, with stony green apple notes over a backdrop of toasted brioche.

title: Payana 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Earthy, gritty berry aromas announce a jammy palate with modest acidic bounce. Following the nose, this Malbec tastes earthy, jammy and a touch herbal. A lively finish with solid fruit flavors and juicy acidity provides for a nice close.

title: Nieto Senetiner 2014 Blend Collection Malbec-Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)
description: A stout opening of black-fruit aromas is thick and chunky. On the palate, this blend of Malbec and Cab Franc feels resiny and full. A flavor mix of blatant oak, related resin and peppery berry fruits finishes jammy, oaky tasting and chewy.

title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2015  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune
description: Produced by the cooperative of the Hautes Côtes, this wine is bright and fruity. It has light tannins and warm, red cherry character. With its acidity and structure it could age, although not for long. Drink from 2018.
